perturbation.original_text:
In the event that Oceanic Time Warner Cable removes the above content and or terminates this agreement prior to December 31, 2006, Oceanic Time
Warner Cable agrees to pay a cancellation fee of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) per month multiplied by the number of months remain on the
agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
In the event that Oceanic Time Warner Cable removes the above content and or terminates this agreement prior to December 31, 2006, Oceanic Time
Warner Cable agrees to pay a cancellation fee of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) per month multiplied by the number of months remain on the
agreement. However, if termination occurs due to unforeseen circumstances such as a change in channel programming strategy, no cancellation fee will be applied.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the cancellation fee clause. The original text states a cancellation fee is always applied if termination occurs before December 31, 2006. The added sentence creates an exception where no fee is applied if termination is due to unforeseen circumstances, making the enforcement of the cancellation fee uncertain. The definition of "unforeseen circumstances" is ambiguous, further complicating the situation.

perturbation.original_text: This agreement will be in effect until the end of 2006 and will be evaluated at that time.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement will be in effect until the end of 2006 and will be evaluated at that time. Notwithstanding the previous sentence, this agreement shall automatically renew for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to the end of the then-current term.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct conflict regarding the agreement's term. The original text indicates the agreement ends in 2006 and will be evaluated. The added sentence stipulates automatic renewal unless a termination notice is given, directly contradicting the initial end date and evaluation provision. This makes it unclear whether the agreement automatically continues beyond 2006 or requires a formal evaluation and subsequent agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Watchit shall have the exclusive right to sell third party advertising as sponsors of their content and will have the right to brand the content under
the Watchit brand and place a “bug” on the screen identifying the content with a Watchit trademark.
perturbation.changed_text:
Watchit shall have the exclusive right to sell third party advertising as sponsors of their content and will have the right to brand the content under
the Watchit brand and place a “bug” on the screen identifying the content with a Watchit trademark. Oceanic Time Warner Cable, however, reserves the right to refuse any advertising that conflicts with its own advertising policies or presents a competitive offering.
perturbation.explanation: This addition creates a contradiction regarding advertising rights. Initially, Watchit has exclusive rights to sell advertising. The added sentence grants Oceanic Time Warner Cable the right to refuse advertising, undermining Watchit's 'exclusive' right. This introduces uncertainty about the extent of Watchit's advertising control and opens the door to disputes over advertising acceptability.
